title: Documentation inconsistency:  Use of io Seeker lists hard-coded numbers
body:
by **cjgrant@google.com**: 
This report pertains to the current online documentation, here:

http://golang.org/pkg/io/#Seeker

The doc indicates use of 0, 1 and 2, which correspond to these constants from the os
package:

  SEEK_SET int = 0 // seek relative to the origin of the file
  SEEK_CUR int = 1 // seek relative to the current offset
  SEEK_END int = 2 // seek relative to the end

Would it be better to suggest using these constants instead of literals?  Or are these
seek values so common/well-known that using any constant from any package is equivalent?
